issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

fields.summary: Use security token protobuf definition from hadoop common

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description: The same definition is repeated across HDFS, MR and YARN. We could use the protobuf definitions.
fields.summary: Add security token protobuf definition to common and use it in hdfs

comments.body: Here is a consolidated patch to show the diff across all the projects looks. I will split it into smaller patches for different projects.

{color:red}-1 overall{color}.  Here are the results of testing the latest attachment 
  http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12562922/HADOOP-9173.patch
  against trunk revision .

    {color:green}+1 @author{color}.  The patch does not contain any @author tags.

    {color:green}+1 tests included{color}.  The patch appears to include 1 new or modified test files.

    {color:green}+1 javac{color}.  The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

    {color:green}+1 javadoc{color}.  The javadoc tool did not generate any warning messages.

    {color:green}+1 eclipse:eclipse{color}.  The patch built with eclipse:eclipse.

    {color:red}-1 findbugs{color}.  The patch appears to introduce 5 new Findbugs (version 1.3.9) warnings.

    {color:green}+1 release audit{color}.  The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

    {color:red}-1 core tests{color}.  The patch failed these unit tests in hadoop-common-project/hadoop-common hadoop-hdfs-project/hadoop-hdfs hadoop-hdfs-project/hadoop-hdfs/src/contrib/bkjournal hadoop-mapreduce-project/hadoop-mapreduce-client/hadoop-mapreduce-client-common hadoop-yarn-project/hadoop-yarn/hadoop-yarn-api hadoop-yarn-project/hadoop-yarn/hadoop-yarn-common hadoop-yarn-project/hadoop-yarn/hadoop-yarn-server/hadoop-yarn-server-common hadoop-yarn-project/hadoop-yarn/hadoop-yarn-server/hadoop-yarn-server-nodemanager:

                  org.apache.hadoop.hdfs.TestHFlush

    {color:green}+1 contrib tests{color}.  The patch passed contrib unit tests.

Test results: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HADOOP-Build/1936//testReport/
Findbugs warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HADOOP-Build/1936//artifact/trunk/patchprocess/newPatchFindbugsWarningshadoop-common.html
Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HADOOP-Build/1936//console

This message is automatically generated.

This patch looks fine to me, except that I think you can also replace the DelegationTokenProto in yarn_protos.proto with this new refactored TokenProto.

Unless I'm missing the pattern, it seems we're pretty inconsistent about capitalizing the .proto files throughout the project. Did you consciously choose to capitalize the name of the file? If not, I'd recommend making it lower case, but I don't feel strongly about it.

I don't think you actually need to split this patch up into smaller ones. The change is straightforward, and it seems better to me to keep it as one, since it is logically a single refactor.

bq. Did you consciously choose to capitalize the name of the file
Several changes have recently been done to capitalize the file names correctly. This is consistent with other files in hadoop-common-project.
Updated patch to replace DelegationTokenProto with TokenProto in yarn

Works for me.

+1, the latest patch looks good to me. Thanks, Suresh.

{color:green}+1 overall{color}.  Here are the results of testing the latest attachment 
  http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12563027/HADOOP-9173.patch
  against trunk revision .

This message is automatically generated.
[~sseth] told me that this patch will disrupt YARN-50. I will commit the common and HDFS changes. I will rebase the YARN and MR patch once YARN-50 goes in and will do it in a separate jira.

YARN side changes look good. Moving from "optional" to "required" on the yarn side shouldn't cause problems.
This change ends up breaking the patch posted on YARN-50 though. If it's not an issue, I'd prefer getting that patch in before making at least the YARN/MR side changes. Otherwise, I can of-course re-base that patch.
Also, for a future jira, RequestDelegationTokenRequest, Response etc - could also be moved to common.
Part of the patch with common and HDFS changes. Given this has been reviewed, I will commit it once I get +1 from Jenkins.
